name: Snake Game Network Workflow
description: Automates the setup and deployment of a networked Snake game.
prompt: Develop a simple networked Snake game with multiplayer capabilities using a command-line interface.

steps.title: Setup Project Structure
steps.prompt: Create a new project directory for the Snake game with folders for source code, assets, and documentation. Initialize a git repository and create a basic README.md file.
steps.verify_prompt: Check if the project directory structure is created with source, assets, and documentation folders. Verify that a git repository is initialized and README.md exists. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if correct.

steps.title: Implement Core Game Logic
steps.prompt: Write the core logic for the Snake game in a suitable programming language (e.g., Python). Include snake movement, collision detection, and food spawning in a single-player mode.
steps.verify_prompt: Run the game logic code to ensure the snake moves, detects collisions, and spawns food correctly. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if the core mechanics work as expected.

steps.title: Add Network Multiplayer Support
steps.prompt: Integrate networking capabilities using a library like sockets or a framework to enable multiplayer mode. Allow at least two players to connect and play simultaneously.
steps.verify_prompt: Test the multiplayer mode by connecting two players and verifying that they can see each other's snakes and play together. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if multiplayer works.

steps.title: Create CLI Interface
steps.prompt: Develop a command-line interface for the Snake game that allows users to start the game, join a multiplayer session, and control the snake using keyboard inputs.
steps.verify_prompt: Test the CLI interface to ensure users can start the game, join multiplayer sessions, and control the snake via keyboard inputs. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if the interface functions correctly.

steps.title: Document and Test
steps.prompt: Write documentation for setting up and playing the game, including multiplayer instructions. Add basic unit tests for core game logic if applicable.
steps.verify_prompt: Verify that documentation is complete and clear. Run any unit tests to ensure core logic is stable. Output <promise>PASS</promise> if documentation and tests are satisfactory.
